overview:
Kruttik, at 22, made it to the top 50 in Googleâ€™s Code Jam 2005 beating 10,000+ participants from all across South East Asia. Since then he has not only won several local code jams but also received multiple client appreciation awards for his work. For over 6 years, Kruttik, has worked as the lead on solving enterprise solutions using all aspects of the java enterprise platform and other open source initiatives (Ruby, JBoss) for GE, Duke University, and other organizations. He has built a Clinical Trial architecture that integrates several major legacy systems to manage participants that go on clinical trials. Kruttik has over 10 yearsâ€™ experience using Java and third party solutions from IBM, Tibco (certified), and BEA/Oracle.

He has no desire to pump out “thrown together” piecemeal solutions that will not serve customers and their businesses over the long term. He is passionate about building solutions that will bring in the future; solutions that will make our lives simpler. He doesnâ€™t accept “good enough” and doesnâ€™t expect his clients to accept it either.
